References

Ahmad, T., Boit, J., & Aakula, A. (2023). The Role of Cross-Functional Collaboration in Digital Transformation. ResearchGate.
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/389744145_The_Role_of_Cross-Functional_Collaboration_in_Digital_Transformation

Alkoud, S., Zainudin, D., Sarif, S. M., & Department of Business Administration, Faculty of Economics and Management Sciences, International Islamic University Malaysia. (2023). Challenges, Barriers, and Obstacle Facing Virtual Teams: a Conceptual Study. In INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF ACADEMIC RESEARCH IN BUSINESS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES (Vols. 4–4).
https://doi.org/10.6007/IJARBSS/v13-i4/6713

Anjali. (2024, September 24). Async vs Sync: The Collaboration Showdown. Multicollab.
https://www.multicollab.com/blog/asynchronous-collaboration/

Aston, B. (2025, October 16). Agile Task Management Software Trend for 2025. The Digital Project Manager.
https://thedigitalprojectmanager.com/tools/best-task-management-software/

Atlassian. (n.d.). Project Timeline Software.
https://www.atlassian.com/agile/project-management/project-timeline-software

Benishek, L. E., & Lazzara, E. H. (2019). Teams in a New Era: Some Considerations and Implications. Frontiers in Psychology, 10.
https://doi.org/10.3389/fpsyg.2019.01006

CorporateOne. (2025a, May 30). Psychological Safety in the Digital Workplace - Corporate One. Corporate One.
https://corporate.one/psychological-safety-in-the-digital-workplace/

Dunn, C. (2024, September 19). The Critical Role Of Collaboration In Digital Transformation | Graitec North America. GRAITEC Group.
https://graitec.com/blog/the-critical-role-of-collaboration-in-digital-transformation/

Evans, N., Miokisan, A., & Du, J. T. (2023). University-industry collaboration as a driver of digital transformation in higher education and enablers. Heliyon, 9(10), e21017.
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.heliyon.2023.e21017

FileCloud. (2023). Content Collaboration Tools for Secured Data Sharing Files.
https://www.filecloud.com/content-collaboration-tools/

Gqwabaza, N., & Maqopa, T. (2024). The Role of Collaboration and Networking in the Digital Age: Students’ Perspectives. Journal of Humanities and Social Sciences, 1757–1769.

Haryadi, A., Kusumawati, A., Noerman, T., & Wiyata, W. (2025). Digital Collaboration in the Modern Era: A Systematic Review of the Literature. Malang.
https://doi.org/10.4108/eai.30-10-2023.3434025

Hodun, L. (2023, September 19). 18 Digital Communication Tools Every Business Should Know. Chanty.
https://www.chanty.com/blog/digital-communication-tools/

Hwang, N. J. Y. (2025). Cross-cultural communication in global teams: Challenges and effective strategies derived from multinational corporations. World of Advances Research and Development, 12(4).
https://doi.org/10.30574/ijar.2025.12.4.1648

Krdzic, Z. (2025, May 29). Synchronous vs. asynchronous communication (for agencies?). ActiveCollab.
https://activecollab.com/blog/collaboration/synchronous-vs-asynchronous-communication

Kumar, A. S., C, V. R., B, B., & Department of Industrial Engineering, R V College of Engineering, Bengaluru, India, & Department of Industrial Engineering and Management, R V College of Engineering, Bengaluru, India. (2025). Data Collaboration Using Privacy-Preserving Technologies. International Journal of Research and Technology (Vol. 12, Issue 2, pp. 87–88).
https://ijirt.org/publishedpaper/IJIRT181925_PAPER.pdf

Landau, P. (2025, October 2). 11 Best Project Timeline Software of 2025 (Free + Paid). ProjectManager.
https://www.projectmanager.com/blog/best-project-timeline-software

Lark, (n.d.). Top 8 Secure Collaboration Tools for Your Team in 2025 | Lark.
https://www.larksuite.com/en_us/blog/secure-collaboration-tools

Luebstorf, S., Allen, J. A., Eden, E., Kramer, W. S., Reiter-Palmon, R., & Lehmann-Willenbrock, N. (2023). Signaling into “Zoom Fatigue”: A Qualitative Exploration of Remote Work Challenges and Virtual Meeting Stressors. Merits, 3(1), 151–166.
https://doi.org/10.3390/merits3010010

MacPhail, J. (2007). Virtual Teams: Secrets of A Successful Long-Distance Research Relationship. A Canadian Perspective. The Annals of Family Medicine, 5(6), 568–569.
https://doi.org/10.1370/afm.784

Mozaic. (2025, April 3). 10 Co-Creation Tools for Creators and Their Creative Partnerships.
https://mozaic-web.prd.azurewebsites.net/10-co-creation-tools-for-creators-and-their-creative-partnerships/

Murugan, K., & M, M. R. (2024). A study on reducing digital fatigue in remote work. International Journal of Foreign Trade and International Business, 6(2), 153–159.
https://doi.org/10.33545/26633410.2024.v6.i2b.130

Odhiambo, B., & Mutyala, S. (2024). Hybrid Work Impact on Building Trust: Exploring Trust-building through Communication in Agile Software Development Teams [MBA Thesis]. Department of Industrial Economics, Blekinge Institute of Technology.
https://www.diva-portal.org/smash/get/diva2:1888053/FULLTEXT01.pdf

Rajput, S. (2025, August 20). Top 7 Trends in Continuous Improvement Software | Insights & Market Growth. Verified Market Reports.
https://www.verifiedmarketreports.com/blog/top-7-trends-in-continuous-improvement-software-market/

Salas, E., Linhardt, R., & Castillo, G. F. (2024). The Science (and Practice) of Teamwork: A Commentary on Forty Years of Team Research. Small Group Research.
https://doi.org/10.1177/10464964241274119

Schulz, Y. (2024, June 11). Digital transformation requires a collaborative culture. Engineering.com.
https://www.engineering.com/story/digital-transformation-requires-a-collaborative-culture

Shuffler, M. L., Salas, E., & Rosen, M. A. (2020). The Evolution and Maturation of Teams in Organizations: Convergent Trends in the New Dynamic Science of Teams. Frontiers in Psychology, 11.
https://doi.org/10.3389/fpsyg.2020.02128

Soveizi, N., Turkmen, F., & Karasotyano, D. (2023). Security and privacy concerns in cloud-based collaboration: A systematic review. Future Generation Computer Systems, 148, 184–200.
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.future.2023.05.015

Stranzinger, D. (2023). BEST PRACTICE APPROACHES FOR LEADING VIRTUAL TEAMS: A GUIDELINE FOR LEADERS OF VIRTUAL TEAMS. In Johannes Kepler Universität Linz & Department of International Management, Master’s Program Management [Master’s Thesis; PDF].
https://epub.jku.at/obvulihs/download/pdf/8718858

Strauss, C., Harer, M., & Bjarnemyr, T. (2024). Analyzing digital communication: a comprehensive framework. Management Review Quarterly.
https://doi.org/10.1007/s11301-024-00455-8

Trign Technologies. (n.d.). The Role of Collaboration Tools in Digital Transformation.
https://trigntech.com/blogs/collaboration-tools-digital-transformation

Verčič, A. T., Verčič, D., & Sopić, A. (2023). A systematic review of digital internal communication. Public Relations Review, 50(1), 102400.
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.pubrev.2023.102400

 


Glossary

 

Term Definition
Accountability Taking responsibility for one’s actions, commitments, and outcomes. In digital teamwork, accountability ensures transparency and reliability.
Asynchronous Collaboration Working together at different times using digital tools such as shared documents, project boards, or recorded updates—ideal for global teams.
Blended Learning A learning approach combining face-to-face instruction with online or digital activities.
Co-Creation A collaborative process where multiple stakeholders jointly design ideas, products, or solutions.
Collaboration Tools Digital platforms that enable communication, file sharing, co-editing, and task management (e.g., Teams, Slack, Miro).
Continuous Improvement The ongoing effort to enhance products, services, or processes through reflection, feedback, and iteration.
Cross-Cultural Communication The exchange of information among people from different cultural backgrounds, requiring awareness of values and communication styles.
Design Thinking A user-centered, creative approach to problem-solving involving empathizing, defining, ideating, prototyping, and testing.
Digital Empathy Understanding and responding to others’ emotions and perspectives through digital channels.
Digital Etiquette Professional and respectful behavior in online communication, ensuring clarity, tone, and inclusivity.
Digital Transformation The integration of digital technologies into all areas of work, changing how teams operate and deliver value.
Hybrid Collaboration A flexible model combining both in-person and remote teamwork to maximize engagement and efficiency.
Inclusivity Ensuring that everyone—regardless of background, role, or location—feels valued and able to participate fully.
Knowledge Sharing The exchange of skills, insights, and experiences within a team to promote learning and improvement.
Innovation The creation and implementation of new ideas that improve processes, products, or collaboration outcomes.
Psychological Safety A team environment where individuals feel safe to express ideas, ask questions, and make mistakes.
Synchronous Collaboration Real-time collaboration, such as live meetings, chats, or workshops, where participants engage simultaneously.
Team Culture The shared values, behaviors, and norms that shape how a group communicates and works together.
Trust The foundation of digital collaboration, built through consistency, integrity, and open communication.
Workflow The structured process or sequence of steps that guide how tasks are organized and completed within a team or project.
